name: Catholic Charities of Eastern Virginia
address: Multiple locations throughout the Tidewater area. The main office is located at 5361-A Virginia Beach Blvd., Virginia Beach, VA 23462
description: Catholic Charities offers a variety of services, including mental health counseling, family engagement, and financial counseling. While not exclusively mediation, their counseling services can help families navigate disputes. They serve people of all faiths and backgrounds

name: Catholic Charities of the Diocese of Arlington
address: Multiple offices throughout the Diocese of Arlington
phone: 703-418-2111 (IPS Center for Psychological Services) or 703-841-2500 (Diocese main line)
description: This organization provides counseling services grounded in Catholic teachings, serving individuals, couples, and families. They offer mental health counseling and support services

name: Diocese of Arlington - Office for Family Life
address: 200 N. Glebe Rd., Suite 523, Arlington, VA 22203-3728
description: This office offers programs and resources for separated and divorced Catholics, including support groups like "Coping & Rebuilding" and "Sharing Hope." While not direct mediation services, they provide support for family conflict resolution

name: Little Falls Mediation
address: Arlington, Virginia (Specific address not readily available, but serves Arlington and surrounding areas)
description: Led by Ellice Halpern, this practice offers divorce and family mediation services, as well as community, workplace, and business dispute resolution. They emphasize a caring and empathetic environment

name: Family Mediation Fairfax VA (Lucy Nichols)
address: Serves Fairfax and Northern Virginia areas
description: Lucy Nichols, an attorney with over 33 years of experience, exclusively practices mediation, focusing on family law matters. She also serves as a Christian Mediator with the non-profit organization Conflict to Peace

name: Virginia Mediation
address: 1119 Caroline Street, Fredericksburg, Virginia. Also offers virtual mediation statewide
description: Virginia Mediation offers solution-oriented mediation for divorce, custody, business, and personal conflicts. They have experience in various legal areas and can integrate experts into the process

name: Greater Richmond Community Mediation Center
description: This center offers mediation and conflict coaching services, with a team of ADR professionals. They provide free, court-ordered mediation in some cases and offer training in conflict resolution

name: Donita King Law Offices (Divorce Mediation)
address: Richmond, Virginia. Also offers online mediation services for those outside Richmond
description: Donita King is a certified divorce mediator offering services for couples seeking an amicable, cost-effective, and private separation. She handles issues like asset division, child custody, and support

name: Richmond Creative Counseling (Divorce Mediation)
address: Multiple locations in Richmond, VA, including Willow Lawn (1900 Byrd Ave, Richmond, VA 23230) and Southside (2550 Professional Rd, North Chesterfield, VA 23235)
description: This multi-specialty practice offers divorce mediation services, with sessions typically scheduled in 3-hour blocks. They aim to facilitate healthy discussion and help couples reach agreements

name: Farrell & Croft, PC (Mediation Services)
description: This firm offers mediation services for custody, divorce, and other family law matters. They emphasize that mediation empowers parties to problem-solve and maintain control over decisions
